`ApolloElement`

üöÄ Custom element base class for apollo lit elements.

See [`ApolloElementInterface`](https://apolloelements.dev/api/core/interfaces/element) for more information on events

declarations.description:
`ApolloMutation`

üë©‚ÄçüöÄ Custom element base class to issue mutations via your Apollo cache.

See [`ApolloMutationInterface`](https://apolloelements.dev/api/core/interfaces/mutation) for more information on events
declarations.name: ApolloMutation

members.name: data
members.description: Latest mutation data.

members.name: variables
members.description: An object that maps from the name of a variable as used in the mutation GraphQL document to that variable's value.
members.summary: Mutation variables.

members.name: called
members.summary: Whether the mutation was called

members.name: mutation
members.summary: The mutation.

members.name: context
members.summary: Context passed to the link execution chain.

members.name: optimisticResponse
members.description:
An object that represents the result of this mutation that
will be optimistically stored before the server has actually returned a
result.

This is most often used for optimistic UI, where we want to be able to see
the result of a mutation immediately, and update the UI later if any errors
appear.

An object that represents the result of this mutation that will be optimistically stored before the server has actually returned a result.
This is most often used for optimistic UI, where we want to be able to see the result of a mutation immediately, and update the UI later if any errors appear.

```ts
element.optimisticResponse = ({ name }: HelloMutationVariables) => ({
  __typename: 'Mutation',
  hello: {
    __typename: 'Greeting',
    name,
  },
});
```

members.name: ignoreResults
members.summary: If true, the returned data property will not update with the mutation result.

members.name: awaitRefetchQueries
members.description:
Queries refetched as part of refetchQueries are handled asynchronously,
and are not waited on before the mutation is completed (resolved).
Setting this to true will make sure refetched queries are completed
before the mutation is considered done. false by default.

members.name: errorPolicy
members.description: Specifies the ErrorPolicy to be used for this mutation.

members.name: fetchPolicy
members.description: Specifies the FetchPolicy to be used for this mutation.

members.name: refetchQueries
members.description:
A list of query names which will be refetched once this mutation has returned.
This is often used if you have a set of queries which may be affected by a mutation and will have to update.
Rather than writing a mutation query reducer (i.e. `updateQueries`) for this,
you can refetch the queries that will be affected
and achieve a consistent store once these queries return.

members.name: updater
members.description:
A function which updates the apollo cache when the query responds.
This function will be called twice over the lifecycle of a mutation.
Once at the very beginning if an optimisticResponse was provided.
The writes created from the optimistic data will be rolled back before
the second time this function is called which is when the mutation has
succesfully resolved. At that point update will be called with the actual
mutation result and those writes will not be rolled back.

The reason a DataProxy is provided instead of the user calling the methods
directly on ApolloClient is that all of the writes are batched together at
the end of the update, and it allows for writes generated by optimistic
data to be rolled back.

members.name: onCompleted
members.description: Callback for when a mutation is completed.

members.name: onError
members.description: Callback for when an error occurs in mutation.

members.name: client
members.summary: The Apollo Client instance.

members.name: loading
members.summary: Whether a request is in flight.

members.name: document
members.summary:
Operation document.
GraphQL operation document i.e. query, subscription, or mutation.
Must be a parsed GraphQL `DocumentNode`

members.name: error
members.summary: Latest error

members.name: errors
members.summary: Latest errors

attributes.name: await-refetch-queries
attributes.description:
Queries refetched as part of refetchQueries are handled asynchronously,
and are not waited on before the mutation is completed (resolved).
Setting this to true will make sure refetched queries are completed
before the mutation is considered done. false by default.

attributes.name: error-policy
attributes.description: Specifies the ErrorPolicy to be used for this mutation.

attributes.name: fetch-policy
attributes.description: Specifies the FetchPolicy to be used for this mutation.

attributes.name: refetch-queries
attributes.description:
A list of query names which will be refetched once this mutation has returned.
This is often used if you have a set of queries which may be affected by a mutation and will have to update.
Rather than writing a mutation query reducer (i.e. `updateQueries`) for this,
you can refetch the queries that will be affected
and achieve a consistent store once these queries return.

declarations.description:
`ApolloQuery`

üöÄ Custom element base class that connects to your Apollo cache.

See [`ApolloQueryInterface`](https://apolloelements.dev/api/core/interfaces/query) for more information on events
declarations.name: ApolloQuery

members.name: data
members.description: Latest query data.

members.name: variables
members.description: An object that maps from the name of a variable as used in the query GraphQL document to that variable's value.
members.summary: Query variables.

members.name: shouldSubscribe
members.description:
Determines whether the element should attempt to subscribe i.e. begin querying
Override to prevent subscribing unless your conditions are met

members.name: canAutoSubscribe
members.summary: Flags an element that's ready and able to auto subscribe

members.name: options
members.description:
All properties are optional

| Property | Type | Description |
| -------- | ---- | ----------- |
| fetchPolicy | `WatchQueryFetchPolicy`{lang=ts} | The [fetchPolicy](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/api/core/ApolloClient/#FetchPolicy) for the query. |
| variables | `Variables<D, V>`{lang=ts} | Variables for the query. |
| noAutoSubscribe | `boolean`{lang=ts} | If true, the element will not begin querying data until you manually call `subscribe` |
| shouldSubscribe | `(op?: Partial<Operation<D, V>) => boolean`{lang=ts} | If true, the element will not begin querying data until you manually call `subscribe` | Determines whether the element should attempt to subscribe automatically\nOverride to prevent subscribing unless your conditions are met |
| onData | `(data: Data<D>) => void`{lang=ts} | Optional callback for when a query resolves. |
| onError | `(error: Error) => void`{lang=ts} | Optional callback for when an error occurs. |

members.name: networkStatus
members.description:
`networkStatus` is useful if you want to display a different loading indicator (or no indicator at all)
depending on your network status as it provides a more detailed view into the state of a network request
on your component than `loading` does. `networkStatus` is an enum with different number values between 1 and 8.
These number values each represent a different network state.

1. `loading`: The query has never been run before and the request is now pending. A query will still have this network status even if a result was returned from the cache, but a query was dispatched anyway.
2. `setVariables`: If a query‚Äôs variables change and a network request was fired then the network status will be setVariables until the result of that query comes back. React users will see this when options.variables changes on their queries.
3. `fetchMore`: Indicates that fetchMore was called on this query and that the network request created is currently in flight.
4. `refetch`: It means that refetch was called on a query and the refetch request is currently in flight.
5. Unused.
6. `poll`: Indicates that a polling query is currently in flight. So for example if you are polling a query every 10 seconds then the network status will switch to poll every 10 seconds whenever a poll request has been sent but not resolved.
7. `ready`: No request is in flight for this query, and no errors happened. Everything is OK.
8. `error`: No request is in flight for this query, but one or more errors were detected.

If the network status is less then 7 then it is equivalent to `loading` being true. In fact you could
replace all of your `loading` checks with `networkStatus < 7` and you would not see a difference.
It is recommended that you use `loading`, however.

members.name: query
members.summary: A GraphQL document containing a single query.

members.name: context
members.summary: Context passed to the link execution chain.

members.name: partial
members.description:
If data was read from the cache with missing fields,
partial will be true. Otherwise, partial will be falsy.
members.summary: True when the query returned partial data.

members.name: partialRefetch
members.description:
If true, perform a query refetch if the query result is marked as being partial,
and the returned data is reset to an empty Object by the Apollo Client QueryManager
(due to a cache miss).

The default value is false for backwards-compatibility's sake,
but should be changed to true for most use-cases.
members.summary: Set to retry any partial query results.

members.name: pollInterval
members.summary: The time interval (in milliseconds) on which this query should be refetched from the server.

members.name: returnPartialData
members.description:
Opt into receiving partial results from the cache for queries
that are not fully satisfied by the cache.

members.name: noAutoSubscribe
members.description:
When true, the component will not automatically subscribe to new data.
Call the `subscribe()` method to do so.

members.name: notifyOnNetworkStatusChange
members.summary: Whether or not updates to the network status should trigger next on the observer of this query.

members.name: errorPolicy
members.description:
errorPolicy determines the level of events for errors in the execution result. The options are:
- `none` (default): any errors from the request are treated like runtime errors and the observable is stopped (XXX this is default to lower breaking changes going from AC 1.0 => 2.0)
- `ignore`: errors from the request do not stop the observable, but also don't call `next`
- `all`: errors are treated like data and will notify observables
members.summary: [Error Policy](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/api/core/ApolloClient/#ErrorPolicy) for the query.

members.name: fetchPolicy
members.description:
Determines where the client may return a result from. The options are:

- `cache-first` (default): return result from cache, fetch from network if cached result is not available.
- `cache-and-network`: return result from cache first (if it exists), then return network result once it's available.
- `cache-only`: return result from cache if available, fail otherwise.
- `no-cache`: return result from network, fail if network call doesn't succeed, don't save to cache
- `network-only`: return result from network, fail if network call doesn't succeed, save to cache
- `standby`: only for queries that aren't actively watched, but should be available for refetch and updateQueries.
members.summary: The [fetchPolicy](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/api/core/ApolloClient/#FetchPolicy) for the query.

members.name: nextFetchPolicy
members.description:
When someone chooses cache-and-network or network-only as their
initial FetchPolicy, they often do not want future cache updates to
trigger unconditional network requests, which is what repeatedly
applying the cache-and-network or network-only policies would seem
to imply. Instead, when the cache reports an update after the
initial network request, it may be desirable for subsequent network
requests to be triggered only if the cache result is incomplete.
The nextFetchPolicy option provides a way to update
options.fetchPolicy after the intial network request, without
having to set options.
members.summary: Set to prevent subsequent network requests when the fetch policy is `cache-and-network` or `network-only`.

members.name: refetch

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description: The new set of variables. If there are missing variables, the previous values of those variables will be used..

members.description: Exposes the [`ObservableQuery#refetch`](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/api/apollo-client.html#ObservableQuery.refetch) method.

members.name: subscribe

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: options for controlling how the subscription subscribes

members.description: Resets the observableQuery and subscribes.

members.name: subscribeToMore
members.description:
Lets you pass a GraphQL subscription and updateQuery function
to subscribe to more updates for your query.

The `updateQuery` parameter is a function that takes the previous query data,
then a `{ subscriptionData: TSubscriptionResult }` object,
and returns an object with updated query data based on the new results.

members.name: executeQuery
members.description: Executes a Query once and updates the with the result

members.name: fetchMore

parameters.name: params
parameters.description:
| Option | Type | Description |
| ------ | ---- | ----------- |
| query | `DocumentNode \| TypedDocumentNode`{lang=ts} | Query to fetch, defaults to `this.query` |
| updateQuery | `Function`{lang=ts} | Function to determine how to update the cache when the query resolves. (deprecated - use field policies instead) |
| variables | `Variables<D, V>`{lang=ts} | Query variables |
| context | `Record<string, unknown>`{lang=ts} | Context object passed through the link execution chain. |

members.description:
Exposes the `ObservableQuery#fetchMore` method.
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/api/core/ObservableQuery/#ObservableQuery.fetchMore

The optional `updateQuery` parameter is a function that takes the previous query data,
then a `{ subscriptionData: TSubscriptionResult }` object,
and returns an object with updated query data based on the new results.

The optional `variables` parameter is an optional new variables object.

members.name: onData
members.description: Optional callback for when a query is completed.

members.name: onError
members.description: Optional callback for when an error occurs.

attributes.name: no-auto-subscribe
attributes.description:
When true, the component will not automatically subscribe to new data.
Call the `subscribe()` method to do so.

attributes.name: error-policy
attributes.description:
errorPolicy determines the level of events for errors in the execution result. The options are:
- `none` (default): any errors from the request are treated like runtime errors and the observable is stopped (XXX this is default to lower breaking changes going from AC 1.0 => 2.0)
- `ignore`: errors from the request do not stop the observable, but also don't call `next`
- `all`: errors are treated like data and will notify observables

attributes.name: fetch-policy
attributes.description:
Determines where the client may return a result from. The options are:

- `cache-first` (default): return result from cache, fetch from network if cached result is not available.
- `cache-and-network`: return result from cache first (if it exists), then return network result once it's available.
- `cache-only`: return result from cache if available, fail otherwise.
- `no-cache`: return result from network, fail if network call doesn't succeed, don't save to cache
- `network-only`: return result from network, fail if network call doesn't succeed, save to cache
- `standby`: only for queries that aren't actively watched, but should be available for refetch and updateQueries.

attributes.name: next-fetch-policy
attributes.description:
When someone chooses cache-and-network or network-only as their
initial FetchPolicy, they often do not want future cache updates to
trigger unconditional network requests, which is what repeatedly
applying the cache-and-network or network-only policies would seem
to imply. Instead, when the cache reports an update after the
initial network request, it may be desirable for subsequent network
requests to be triggered only if the cache result is incomplete.
The nextFetchPolicy option provides a way to update
options.fetchPolicy after the intial network request, without
having to set options.
attributes.summary: Set to prevent subsequent network requests when the fetch policy is `cache-and-network` or `network-only`.

declarations.description:
`ApolloSubscription`

üöÄ Custom element base class that updates with an Apollo GraphQL subscription.

See [`ApolloSubscriptionInterface`](https://apolloelements.dev/api/core/interfaces/subscription) for more information on events
declarations.name: ApolloSubscription

members.name: canAutoSubscribe
members.summary: Flags an element that's ready and able to auto subscribe

members.name: subscription
members.summary: A GraphQL document containing a single subscription.

members.name: noAutoSubscribe
members.summary: If true, the element will not begin querying data until you manually call `subscribe`

members.name: notifyOnNetworkStatusChange
members.summary: Whether or not updates to the network status should trigger next on the observer of this subscription.

members.name: shouldResubscribe
members.summary: Determines if your subscription should be unsubscribed and subscribed again.

members.name: skip
members.summary: If true, the query will be skipped entirely

members.name: errorPolicy
members.summary: Error policy for the subscription

members.name: fetchPolicy
members.summary: Specifies the FetchPolicy to be used for this subscription.

members.name: pollInterval
members.summary: The time interval (in milliseconds) on which this subscription should be refetched from the server.

members.name: subscribe
members.summary: Resets the observable and subscribes.

members.name: cancel
members.summary: Cancels and clears the subscription

members.name: shouldSubscribe
members.description:
Determines whether the element should attempt to subscribe automatically
Override to prevent subscribing unless your conditions are met

members.name: onSubscriptionData
members.description: Callback for when data is updated

members.name: onError
members.description: Callback for when error is updated

members.name: onSubscriptionComplete
members.description: Callback for when subscription completes.

members.name: client
members.summary: The Apollo Client instance.

members.name: context
members.summary: Context passed to the link execution chain.

members.name: loading
members.summary: Whether a request is in flight.

members.summary: Latest Data.

members.name: document
members.summary:
Operation document.
GraphQL operation document i.e. query, subscription, or mutation.
Must be a parsed GraphQL `DocumentNode`

members.summary: Latest error

members.name: errors
members.summary: Latest errors

members.name: variables
members.summary: Operation variables.

attributes.summary: If true, the element will not begin querying data until you manually call `subscribe`

attributes.name: fetch-policy
attributes.summary: Specifies the FetchPolicy to be used for this subscription.
